Bases

Colors

In the ProReNata brand we have two brand colors, red and yellow. These are to be used boldly to create interest and delight.

These are complemented with surface colors and feedback colors. Surface colors are, as the name implies, to be used for surfaces in the UI. Feedback colors are colors which communicate something (like warning, danger and success).

Primary

@cSol
#501
@cFabric
#FAB21C

Surface

@cS50
#FFFFFF
@cS100
#EFF2F3
@cS200
#D0D8DA
@cS300
#A7B7BB
@cS400
#96A9AD
@cS500
#859BA0
@cS600
#748D93
@cS700
#657D82
@cS800
#586C71
@cS900
#4B5C60

Feedback

@cDanger
rgb(251,207,189)
@cInfo
rgb(197,219,242)
@cSuccess
rgb(216,234,204)
@cWarning
rgb(251,238,202)
@cUpdate
rgb(249,224,250)

Typography

@cDark100
rgb(36,28,21)
@cDark75
rgba(36,28,21,.75)
@cDark50
rgba(36,28,21,.5)
@cDark30
rgba(36,28,21,.3)

Grid

The grid is fluid with just a few different options based on 4ths and 3rds. The colums are named by width ratio where 1/2 is col-1-2 and 1/3 is col-1-3 etc. These can be nested freely and will be sized in ration to it's parent. On smaller devices all columns will be 100% of the width.

The grid lives inside the container wrapper. This keeps the main column at the right size and centered. If the page has side navigation the conainer should also have the container-with-nav class.

To get the correct padding the inner most content is to be wrapped in a div with the class content. One can also add content-paper or content-sink to style the container.

Check out this example with the grid in the layout.

A long time ago, in a galaxy far, far, away...

It is a period of civil war. Rebel spaceships, striking from a hidden base, have won their first victory against the evil Galactic Empire.

You're a part of the Rebel Alliance... and a traitor. Take her away!
Another blast shakes them as they struggle along their way.
During the battle, Rebel spies managed to steal secret plans to the Empire's ultimate weapon, the Death Star, an armored space station with enough power to destroy an entire planet.
Don't play games with me, Your Highness. You weren't on any mercy mission this time. You passed directly through a restricted system. Several transmissions were beamed to this ship by Rebel spies. I want to know what happened to the plans they sent you. 
<div class="container">
	<div class="col col-1-4">
		<div class="content">
			<p>A long time ago, in a galaxy far, far, away...</p>
		</div>
	</div>
	<div class="col col-1-2">
		<div class="content">
			<p>It is a period of civil war. Rebel spaceships, striking from a hidden base, have won their first victory against the evil Galactic Empire.</p>
		</div>
	</div>
	<div class="col col-1-4">
		<div class="content content-paper">
			You're a part of the Rebel Alliance... and a traitor. Take her away!
		</div>
	</div>
	<div class="col col-1-3">
		<div class="content content-sink">
			Another blast shakes them as they struggle along their way.
		</div>
	</div>
	<div class="col col-2-3">
		<div class="content content-paper">
			During the battle, Rebel spies managed to steal secret plans to the Empire's ultimate weapon, the Death Star, an armored space station with enough power to destroy an entire planet.
		</div>
	</div>
	<div class="col col-1-1">
		<div class="content">
			Don't play games with me, Your Highness. You weren't on any mercy mission this time. You passed directly through a restricted system. Several transmissions were beamed to this ship by Rebel spies. I want to know what happened to the plans they sent you.
		</div>
	</div>
</div>

Typography

Styles

These are the headings. Make sure to maintain a clear hierarchy.

Main Heading

Subpage title

Section heading

Sub section heading

Body

Small Body

<h1>Main Heading</h1>
<h2>Subpage title</h2>
<h3>Section heading</h3>
<h4>Sub section heading</h4>
<!-- <h5>Heading Level 5</h5>
<h6>Heading Level 6</h6> -->
<p>Body</p>
<p class="text-small">Small Body</p>

Paragraphs

Default text

If you pry it up, so as to get it overhead, and expose its rows of teeth, it seems a terrific portcullis; and such, alas! it proves to many a poor wight in the fishery, upon whom these spikes fall with impaling force.

Small meta text

But far more terrible is it to behold, when fathoms down in the sea, you see some sulky whale, floating there suspended, with his prodigious jaw, some fifteen feet long, hanging straight down at right-angles with his body, for all the world like a ship's jib-boom.

Small meta text, muted

This whale is not dead; he is only dispirited; out of sorts, perhaps; hypochondriac; and so supine, that the hinges of his jaw have relaxed, leaving him there in that ungainly sort of plight, a reproach to all his tribe, who must, no doubt, imprecate lock-jaws upon him.

<h4>Default text</h4>
<p>If you pry it up, so as to get it overhead, and expose its rows of teeth, it seems a terrific portcullis; and such, alas! it proves to many a poor wight in the fishery, upon whom these spikes fall with impaling force.</p>

<h4>Small meta text</h4>
<p class="text-small">But far more terrible is it to behold, when fathoms down in the sea, you see some sulky whale, floating there suspended, with his prodigious jaw, some fifteen feet long, hanging straight down at right-angles with his body, for all the world like a ship's jib-boom.</p>

<h4>Small meta text, muted</h4>
<p class="text-small text-muted">This whale is not dead; he is only dispirited; out of sorts, perhaps; hypochondriac; and so supine, that the hinges of his jaw have relaxed, leaving him there in that ungainly sort of plight, a reproach to all his tribe, who must, no doubt, imprecate lock-jaws upon him.</p>
